data.title: Open in web browser
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.7.2 (7ba55c5860b152d999dda59393ca3ebeb1b5c85f, 2016-11-21T22:06:37.428Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.3.9600
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|vscode-caniuse|akamud|0.5.3|
|angular1-code-snippets|alexandersage|0.0.3|
|vscode-color|anseki|0.2.2|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.1.0|
|live-html-previewer|hdg|0.0.1|
|vscode-exec-node|miramac|0.1.8|
|vscode-jade-snippets|mrmlnc|1.0.1|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.5.3|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1.Open visual studio code
2. Right-click over a file html and selecting open in web browser
http://screencast.com/t/RFRveCTvma7F

data.title: Code Formatting : Is there a way to format correctly Twig or Swig tags ?
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7 or 1.8.0 Insider
- OS Version: Mac OS 10,11,4

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open an HTML code with swig or twig tags
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2274006/20795206/339c9e1c-b7d0-11e6-94da-02abd86f8bbf.png)

2. Format the code. Result is :
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2274006/20795225/473b3bc2-b7d0-11e6-93ba-477bca9aaae9.png)


Tried to find extensions for Twig, no one is handling code formatting. Is there anyway to configure internal code format to handle that ?

data.title: Peek/Go To Definition & Click to Open do not work with Webpack alias
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.0-insider
- OS Version: OSX El Capitan 10.11.6

Using normal, path based imports, Peek/Go To Definition and CMD+Click to open file from import work wonderfully. When using a [Webpack alias](http://webpack.github.io/docs/configuration.html#resolve-alias), Peek/Go To no longer work. It kind of "fails silently" in that nothing appears (not even an error message).

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Add an alias to a webpack config file
2. Import a file using an ES6 import with the path to the file that includes the Webpack alias

Desired Behavior:
1. Using a Webpack alias inside an ES6 import, Peek/Go To Definition display in the same manner as when using a full path inside an import. 
2. CMD+Click to Open File from import statement works with both full paths and webpack aliases

I've created a reduced repo that demonstrates the behavior: https://github.com/damonbauer/webpack-alias-demo/

I'm setting an alias in the [webpack config](https://github.com/damonbauer/webpack-alias-demo/blob/master/webpack.config.js#L13) to map the word `app` to the path of `/src`. Then in a file, I'm [importing another](https://github.com/damonbauer/webpack-alias-demo/blob/master/src/App.js) with ES6 imports.

Edit: I'm also using the [PathIntellisense extension](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=christian-kohler.path-intellisense) with custom mappings so I can get path autocompletion when using an alias in an import. Perhaps there could be something helpful in that repo?

data.title: Powershell $PSScriptRoot (No simple way to run scripts)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.0-insider
- OS Version: Windows 7

Steps to Reproduce:

1. install powershell extension
2. make a script using $PSScriptRoot   (directory of script)
3. Highlight code and press F8

$PSSScriptRoot is always C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code Insiders

This messes up all my scripts. and this is the only easy way of running code. The only way I can get the script to run correctly is to open the folder and run debug. 

Love visual code but why is there no way of running code easily

data.title: ATA puts types in $HOME/Microsoft
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04

I have yet to find out how to reproduce this, but VS Code creates a *Microsoft/TypeScript/node_modules/* directory with the *types-registry* npm module in it in the home directory.

The package readme says

>This is the source code for the types-publisher service, which publishes the contents of DefinitelyTyped to npm.

I never set anything to be shared or published. So what exactly is this and what does it do?

data.title: [decorators] before/after decorators for empty lines

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04.1 LTS

I would like to display github review comments as text-decorations in visible editors. Unfortunately the decorations are not shown for empty lines. Is there a reason to not display them in this case?
IMHO the before and after elements of the decorations should be visible.

data.title: Support a virtual folder view that shows files from many places
data.body: Can join a virtual folder? Similar to the function of group Xcode, all files on the physical disk in the same folder, and the compiler inside the organization with the group file, it will be very convenient to use a lot of places.

data.title: Is it possible to author plugins in ES6?
data.body:
I have a question-is it possible to author plugins in ES6 easily?
Atom editor has a convention of `"format es6"` similar to `"use strict"` at the top of the file which allows developers to use ES6 instead of coffescript. VScode allows to use plain JS, but it does not work with ES6. I know I can achieve the same with babel-register, but it would sure be nice to have it built in.

What do you think?

data.title: How to point to PHP executable?
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2
- OS Version: Max osX 10.11

Steps to Reproduce:

Hi, I'm trying to point VSCode to my PHP executable.  I'm on a Mac and using MAMP Pro, which I believe is the PHP executable that I'm suppose to point to.  

I've gone into settings.json and added this line:

```
// Points to the php executable.
"php.validate.executablePath":  "/Applications/MAMP/bin/php/php7.0.12/bin"
```

Here's an image to help if needed.
![screen shot - 2016-11-30 at 9 37 46 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/20779835/20782946/48e8af76-b745-11e6-99eb-06ce1371f910.png)

Not sure if I entered the file path wrong or if I should use a different one, it doesn't seem to click.  I still get a message that PHP executable is not connected to VSCode.

Also, new to Github and trying to tag this as a question but don't see an option to tag a label to this post.

data.title: previewHTML: content reload
data.body:
If editor tab that contains `previewHTML` instance is switched off and then switched on again it reloads the content, I think I would be useful to have a mode, where it is not reloaded between switches.

Also it would be useful to have imperative update/reload feature.

data.title: Keep one search worker process alive between searches
data.body:
Needs more investigation, from #16286.

Starting up the search worker processes does not take very long, but for searches in small workspaces, it's a significant piece of the total time. A search that could feel instant feels a little slower than instant. I don't think it's significant enough for this milestone, but it might be worse on other machines and would be worth looking at in the future.

Also I say one process because we probably don't want to add 8 new processes per window, but having just one would help a lot for the smaller workspaces. The timing was done keeping all processes alive though.

Times in seconds

## Chromium (large)
| |Not persisted|Persisted|
|---|---|---|
|`enter` keypress|0|0|
|first batch sent to worker|.35|.08
|first batch received|1.07|.08
|search complete|26.74|23.67

## vscode (medium)
| |Not persisted|Persisted|
|---|---|---|
|`enter` keypress|0|0
|first batch sent to worker|.23|.04
|first batch received|.49|.49
|search complete|1.31|.38

## 4 files in a folder (small)
| |Not persisted|Persisted|
|---|---|---|
|`enter` keypress|0|0|
|search complete|.59|.05

data.title: Hot exit empty workspace support
data.body: Fixes #13733

data.title: Add font settings for markdown preview
data.body:
Fixes #4641

Adds basic settings for controlling the markdown preview font. We already support this with custom css, but these settings are similar to what the editor and integrated terminal expose and allow for a few basic customizations. Custom style sheets will override these and are still the preferred approach for more extensive customization.

![nov-30-2016 17-53-18](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12821956/20778892/e9e1782e-b725-11e6-952c-7f100c263f8d.gif)

Testing out the new settings UX, normal file searches <kbd>command</kbd><kbd>f</kbd> correctly find the location of strings in the default settings file but do not expand the section the result is found in:

data.title: [c++] noexcept and override don't get correctly highlighted
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2
- OS Version: 10.11.6 (El Capitan)

### Example:
![screen shot 2016-11-30 at 19 25 43](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1908886/20777111/de05fb30-b732-11e6-8a5f-ac670c9cb604.png)

### Code:
```c++
override
void foo() override
{
}

noexcept
void bar() noexcept
{
}
```
Funnily enough, GitHub's C++ synthax highlighter has the opposite result!

data.title: Add TS Code Action Provider
data.body:
With #16295, TS now supplies code actions for automatically fixing a limited set of errors. This change creates a new CodeActionProvider for the TypeScript extension. 

Fixes #16542

data.title: Title Bar Actions Not Refreshed In Some Scenarios
data.body:
Discovered while investigating #12837

**Bug**
Title bar actions with same id but different arguments are not properly handled in `titleControl.ts`. An action with a command will not be replaced by a new one with the same command but a different argument.

You can see this in the following scenario:

1. Create workspace with two md files, `a.md` and `b.md`.
2. Open previews for both files.
3. Open the preview for `a.md` again.
4. Switch to the preview for `b.md`.
5. Click the show source button in the `b.md` preview.

The editor switches to `a.md` instead of `b.md`.

Both the `a.md` and `b.md` previews register the same action (`markdown.showSource`) but with different arguments (the document URI in this case). We calculate these title actions correctly in both cases, but do not refresh them when switching to the `b.md` preview from the `a.md` preview because of this logic:

https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/browser/parts/editor/titleControl.ts#L402

That line looks only at the action ids, which are both `markdown.showSource`, so we do not update the action in the UI.

**Potential Fix**
Check argument when comparing actions

data.title: Consider moving new Emmet menu items under Edit menu group
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.0 Insiders
- OS Version: Windows 10

Currently the two Emmet commands (Emmet: Expand Abbreviation, Emmet...) are under the new Selection menu group. The Emmet commands have nothing to do with Selection and might be better under the Edit menu group.

data.title: Consider renaming "Zen Mode" to "Focus Mode"
data.body:
The term "Zen Mode" may not translate well and might possibly be flagged by PoliCheck tools as it is school of the Buddhist religion.
Consider something like "Focus Mode" or "Editor Only Mode".

data.title: Adopt TS 2.1.3-insiders
data.body: Adopts the 2.1.3 insiders build of TS in the TS extension.
